summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons memorandum from the Northeast Regional Office to MCC New York, announcing the arrival of an After Action Review team to investigate the apparent suicide of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The memo outlines the team's purpose, expected duration, and logistical requirements for staff cooperation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the After Action Review, identified as an inmate who died by apparent suicide at MCC New York.

events.title: After Action Review Team Deployment
events.description: A team of Bureau of Prisons staff arrives at MCC New York to conduct an After Action Review regarding the apparent suicide of inmate Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: Northeast Regional Office (Federal Bureau of Prisons)
keyFacts: The Bureau of Prisons initiated an After Action Review on August 14, 2019, to investigate the apparent suicide of inmate Jeffrey Epstein.
The review team was to have independent access to videos and electronic records, potentially using external hard drives or local network access.
The memo instructs MCC New York staff to be responsive to the team's requests and to ensure local union representation is quickly accessible.
The team was composed of senior staff from various BOP regions and divisions, including Correctional Services, Health Services, Psychology, and Programs.
